description.text:
This IOC represents the predefined PCC rules, which are
configured to SMF and referenced by PCF.

It specifies the transports TSCAI input parameters for TSC
traffic at the ingress interface of the DS-TT/UE for a PCC rule.

It identifies the time period between the start of two bursts
in reference to the TSN GM.

It Indicates the arrival time (in date-time format) of the
data burst in reference to the TSN GM.
It specifies the specifies the condition data for a PCC rule.
It uniquely identifies the condition data.

It indicates the time (in date-time format) when the decision
data shall be activated.

It indicates the time (in date-time format) when the decision
data shall be deactivated.

It provides the condition of access type of the UE when the
session AMBR shall be enforced.

It provides the condition of RAT type of the UE when the
session AMBR shall be enforced.
It specifies the traffic distribution rule, see TS 29.512.
It indicates the value of the steering mode, see TS 29.512.
It indicates the active access, see TS 29.571.
It indicates the Standby access, see TS 29.571.

It indicates the traffic load to steer to the 3GPP Access
expressed in one percent.
It indicates the high priority access.

It specifies the information about the AF subscriptions of the
UP path change.

It provides notification address (Uri) of AF receiving the
event notification.

It is used to set the value of Notification Correlation ID in
the notification sent by the SMF, see TS 29.512
It indicates the type of DNAI change, see TS 29.512

It identifies whether the AF acknowledgement of UP path
event notification is expected.
It specifies the traffic routing information.

It defines the Ipv4 address of the tunnel end point in the
data network, formatted in the dotted decimal notation.

It defines the Ipv6 address of the tunnel end point in the
data network.

It defines the UDP port number of the tunnel end point in
the data network, see TS 29.571

It specifies a list of location which the traffic shall be
routed to for the AF request.
It represents the DNAI (Data network access identifier).
It identifies the routing profile.
It provides the traffic routing information.

It specifies the redirect information for traffic control in
the PCC rule.
It indicates whether the redirect instruction is enabled.
It indicates the type of redirect address.
It indicates the address of the redirect server.

It specifies the traffic control data for a service
flow of a PCC rule.

It univocally identifies the traffic control policy data
within a PDU session.

It represents whether the service data flow(s) are enabled
or disabled.

It indicates whether applicat'on's start or stop notification
is to be muted.
It references to a pre-configured traffic steering policy for downlink traffic at the SMF, see TS 29.512

It references to a pre-configured traffic steering policy for
uplink traffic at the SMF, see TS 29.512
It indicates the applicable traffic steering functionality.
It indicates whether the service data flow, corresponding to the service data flow template, is allowed or not allowed.

It contains the redirect information indicating whether the
detected application traffic should be redirected to another controlled
address.

It contains the additional redirect information indicating
whether the detected application traffic should be redirected to another
controlled address.

The list of redirect information indicating whether the
detected application traffic should be redirected to another
controlled address.

It provides a list of location which the traffic shall be
routed to for the AF request.

The list of location which the traffic shall be routed to
for the AF request.

It provides the traffic distribution rule across 3GPP and
Non-3GPP accesses to apply for downlink traffic.
It provides the traffic distribution rule across 3GPP and Non-3GPP accesses to apply for uplink traffic.
It specifies the allocation and retention priority of a QoS control policy.
It defines the relative importance of a resource request.
It defines whether a service data flow may get resources that were already assigned to another service data flow with a lower priority level.
It defines whether a service data flow may lose the resources assigned to it in order to admit a service data flow with higher priority level.
It specifies the QoS control policy data for a service flow of a PCC rule.
It identifies the QoS control policy data for a PCC rule.
It indicates the 5QI value.
It represents the maximum uplink bandwidth.
It represents the maximum downlink bandwidth.
It represents the guaranteed uplink bandwidth.
It represents the guaranteed downlink bandwidth.
It indicates whether notifications are requested from 3GPP NG-RAN when the GFBR can no longer (or again) be guaranteed for a QoS Flow during the lifetime of the QoS Flow.
Indicates whether the QoS information is reflective for the corresponding non-GBR service data flow
It indicates, by containing the same value, what PCC rules may share resource in downlink direction.
It indicates, by containing the same value, what PCC rules may share resource in uplink direction.
It indicates the downlink maximum rate for lost packets that can be tolerated for the service data flow.
It indicates the uplink maximum rate for lost packets that can be tolerated for the service data flow.
It denotes the largest amount of data that is required to be transferred within a period of 5G-AN PDB, see TS 29.512
It describes an Ethernet flow.

It specifies the destination MAC address formatted in the
hexadecimal .

reference.text: clause 1.1 and clause 2.1 of IETF RFC

description.text: A two-octet string that represents the Ethertype.

reference.text: IEEE 802.3 and IETF RFC 7042 in hexadecimal representation.

description.text: It contains the flow description for the Uplink or Downlink IP flow. It shall be present when the ethtype is IP.
It indicates the packet filter direction.

It specifies the source MAC address formatted in the
hexadecimal notation.

reference.text: clause 1.1 and clause 2.1 of IETF RFC 7042

description.text: It specifies the source MAC address end. If this attribute is present, the sourceMacAddr attribute specifies the source MAC address start. E.g. srcMacAddrEnd with value 00-10-A4-23-3E-FE and sourceMacAddr with value 00-10-A4-23-3E-02 means all MAC addresses from 00-10-A4-23-3E-02 up to and including 00-10-A4-23-3E-FE.
It specifies the destination MAC address end. If this attribute is present, the destMacAddr attribute specifies the destination MAC address start.

It specifies the Customer-VLAN and/or Service-VLAN tags
containing the VID, PCP/DEI fields as defined in IEEE 802.1Q and
IETF RFC 7042. The first/lower instance in the array stands for the
Customer-VLAN tag and the second/higher instance in the array stands
for the Service-VLAN tag.
It specifies the flow information of a PCC rule.
It defines a packet filter for an IP flow.
It is the identifier of the packet filter.
It indicates if the packet shall be sent to the UE.
It contains the Ipv4 Type-of-Service and mask field or the Ipv6 Traffic-Class field and mask field.
It is the security parameter index of the IPSec packet.
It specifies the Ipv6 flow label header field.
It indicates the direction/directions that a filter is applicable.
It specifies the PCC rule, see TS 29.512
It identifies the PCC rule.

A reference to the application detection filter configured
at the UPF.
It is the ATSSS rule application descriptor.
Indicates the content version of the PCC rule.

It indicates the order in which this PCC rule is applied
relative to other PCC rules within the same PDU session.

Indicates the protocol used for signalling between the UE
and the AF, the default value is NO_INFORMATION.

It indicates the application relocation possibility, the
default value is NO_INFORMATION.
It Indicates whether UE IP address should be preserved.
It is a list of IP flow packet filter information.
The list of IP flow packet filter information.
It contains the QoS control policy data for a PCC rule.
The list of QoS control policy data.

It contains the QoS control policy data for the Alternative
QoS parameter sets of the service data flow.
The list of QoS control policy data.
It contains the traffic control policy data for a PCC rule.
The list of traffic control policy data.
It contains transports TSCAI input parameters for TSC traffic at the ingress interface of the DS-TT/UE (uplink flow direction).
It contains transports TSCAI input parameters for TSC traffic at the ingress of the NW-TT (downlink flow direction).
Represents the PredefinedPccRuleSet IOC.
The list of predefined PCC rules.
It specifies the PredefinedPccRuleSet IOC with inherited attributes.
Specifies the predefined PCC rules.
It contains the attributes defined specifically in the PredefinedPccRuleSet IOC.
It specifies the containment relation of PredefinedPccRuleSet MOI with SMFFunction MOI.
It specifies the containment relation of PredefinedPccRuleSet MOI with PCFFunction MOI.
